title: Long build times for conflicting trait implementations (>35min on GitHub CI)

labels.name: I-compiletime
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to compile times.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried to compile this code: https://github.com/JonahPlusPlus/bevy_atmosphere/tree/4a0df51f7817e1f50294fc7abf69b5455cbc4f9e

I expected this to compile relatively quickly.

Instead, it took really long, and I thought that the compiler was broken. However, after 35min, my CI finished.

It returned the following error:
```shell
error[E0119]: conflicting implementations of trait `bevy::reflect::TypeData` for type `model::AtmosphereModelMetadata`
  --> src/model/mod.rs:49:1
   |
49 | impl TypeData for AtmosphereModelMetadata {
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: conflicting implementation in crate `bevy_reflect`:
           - impl<T> TypeData for T
             where T: 'static, T: Send, T: Sync, T: Clone;
```

It turns out that I didn't need to implement [`TypeData`](https://docs.rs/bevy_reflect/latest/bevy_reflect/trait.TypeData.html) since it is already implemented for types that implement `Clone`.

I fixed it by simply removing my implementation, but I'm making this issue because waiting 35min to figure out the problem is frankly unacceptable and I'm sure the maintainers would like samples to figure out the root of the problem.

(I've tested this on the latest stable and nightly, both with the same results)

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose` (on my machine, it's different in the CI):
```
rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120
commit-date: 2022-11-02
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.65.0
LLVM version: 15.0.0
```
